info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 10:18PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SNOW COVERED ROADS AND BLACK ICE TO AFFECT SOME LOCATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS OF WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA, UPSTATE SOUTH CAROLINA, AND NORTHEAST GEORGIA THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... Many mountain locations received accumulating snowfall this morning. Many of these areas, especially along the higher terrain and near the Tennessee border, will have temperatures at or below freezing through late day and falling into the teens and 20s overnight. Areas of black ice may therefore develop on area roadways, leading to very slippering conditions. Use caution if driving in the North Carolina mountains or adjacent locales in northeast Georgia. Temperatures should rise above freezing and permit melting and drying by midday Tuesday.
